summary: The document serves as a recommendation and citation for Mr. David S. Morales to receive the Intelligence Medal of Merit in recognition of his 25 years of dedicated service with the Central Intelligence Agency (CIA). It outlines his distinguished career, beginning with his service in the United States Army from April 1946 to March 1951, followed by over 20 years of field assignments in Europe, Latin America, and East Asia. Morales held senior positions in various operations, demonstrating leadership and operational successes in hazardous areas. His contributions were highly regarded by his superiors and foreign governments, leading to multiple commendations. Notably, he played pivotal roles in operations in Cuba, the Dominican Republic, Laos, and Vietnam. Known for his resourcefulness and ability to manage under challenging conditions, Morales retired on July 31, 1975, and was awarded the Intelligence Medal of Merit for his exceptional service to the CIA.
key_findings: Mr. Morales served in the United States Army from April 1946 to March 1951 before joining the CIA.
He spent over 20 years in field assignments in Europe, Latin America, and East Asia, holding senior positions in various operations.
Morales was commended multiple times for his service, including by the Director of Central Intelligence and foreign governments.
He played key roles in significant operations, including in Cuba, the Dominican Republic, Laos, and Vietnam.
Morales was known for his resourcefulness, imagination, and ability to manage large installations and groups under hazardous conditions.
After nearly 30 years of service, he retired on July 31, 1975, and was awarded the Intelligence Medal of Merit for his exceptional contributions to the CIA.
